text: I am also learning HubSpot and eager to become a certified developer.
Go into settings are and then in Domains and URLs make sure your blog is connected to your site domain.  Then in Blog make sure your Blog Root Url is how you want it.
A Blog in HubSpot has this already built-in if that works for your needs

Hmm, I’m sure I would have found that by now. Could you please refer me to the documentation on this?

I’ve seen the private Knowledge Base pages and the Private content, but not the option where the user can see half of the content…
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/blog/create-and-publish-blog-posts>
Thanks for the effort Scott, I’m not quite sure I understand how this summary length will help in my case.

What content are you trying to show summaries for?  If you put that content into a blog section instead that may be where it could help by creating or editing the way the blog listing displays.  This may not be what you're trying to do though it sounds like.

Oh, the part on how to trim the content is something I could handle. Even though using the summary looks better than truncating it manually, so thanks for the idea.

The part I’m trying to figure out is how to add a condition on hubl before the content is rendered, based on the fact if the visitor has subscribed or not.

I’m already trying an approach so I’ll post the results here in case someone else needs it in the future!
The idea is to have the same article, like <http://medium.com|medium.com> has, but instead of having users to register, i want to have them subscribe
For an example, here is a section of our home page that shows the latest blog article with a custom Read More...  It is built with a custom section template
Custom page template or custom section template
Am I just blind or is there no way to see marketing email opens by the different subject lines you've used for an email with smart rules?

Hi guys. I've been tasked to use the calling extensions sdk to connect HubSpot to our telecoms platform.
I was wondering, is it simply the case of using the demo code and adapt that, or do we also need to make use of the oauth-quickstart?

I noticed that <https://github.com/HubSpot/calling-extensions-sdk/tree/master/demos/demo-react-ts> uses visitor-ui-component-library which was removed from npm because it contained malicious code.
Has the code within the calling-extensions-sdk demo been reviewed for the malicious code and is safe to use?
I noticed this because vite doesn't like some of the code in visitor-ui-component-library
I thought I read somewhere that HubSpot supports storing PII data inside custom properties.  Was I imagining this update?

This beta might be the thing you heard about <@U05R380MLMC>

Store sensitive data in HubSpot's Smart CRM
17 Apr 2024

What is it?
As part of this rollout, customers will be able to create custom properties that store sensitive information, and then restrict user access to the properties using field level permissions. Examples of sensitive information that will be covered by this rollout include government ID number, low-risk financial data, and non-HIPAA-covered medical information.

Why does it matter?
Enabling customers to store sensitive data in HubSpot opens the door to more use cases that have not yet been possible for HubSpot users. Now, with sensitive data, users can collaborate effectively across teams, run reports using enhanced data, create segments, and more. With sensitive data, there’s no longer a need to leverage workarounds or keep this data outside of HubSpot.

How does it work?
To store sensitive information in your HubSpot account, users with Super Admin permissions can turn on the sensitive data setting. Once the setting is turned on, you can create custom properties that store sensitive information. Additionally, you can restrict user access to these properties using field level permissions.
Ok! Yes!  Show me the documentation! <@U04CC57CMBP>
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/properties/store-sensitive-data>
I see - it's in Beta so probably needed to subscribe to it
Yeah that is right
And once you turn it on, there is no turning it off, from what I understood. I have not done it anywhere yet
Enrolled in the beta <@U05R380MLMC>, thanks <@U01NRM1BS3A>
I'd assume that if you turned it off, then all protected properties would go with it
We can see, it’s in sandbox
I just saw this
Not sure what the implications are once turned on
We will let you know!  Got a few good use cases for this feature
Thanks
Yeah many many use cases :slightly_smiling_face:
Next throw in HIPAA compliance and governments will start using HubSpot :smile:
Sure!  5 years after the feature gets released
